title: I was autofilled mid, now I'm autofill protected.
body:
http://i0.kym-cdn.com/photos/images/newsfeed/001/051/057/4cf.jpg

What occult magic has taken place for this divine privilege to be gifted upon me?




Has this happened to anyone else? How frequently?

replies.body:
I queued as top, autofilled top.
?
and autofill protected

Copy and pasted from a similar thread earlier

> The game looks at the team it gets like this
> 
> Player 1 - queue'd adc/mid
> Player 2 - queue'd mid/jungle
> Player 3 - queue'd adc/mid
> Player 4 - queue'd top/mid
> Player 5 - queue'd mid/adc
> 
> Only one player should be filled right? Wrong the game does this
> 
> Player 1 - adc
> Player 2 - mid
> Player 3 - autofilled top
> Player 4 - autofilled jungle
> Player 5 - autofilled support
> 
> It has 0 checks in place to make sure the lowest number of players get filled.

In your case this worked out lovely for you eh?
I'd say about 90% of the time everyone gets what they want, except for the person supporting. Barely do 2 people get auto filled and I play quite a lot so this is pretty exaggerating.

I've been queued as support/mid and gotten auto-filled top, while the person who got assigned support was also auto-filled and had top as their secondary role.

We swapped and it was all good, but a silly situation never-the-less.

So again, it's not like it cant happen. but people are forgetting that some people are autofilled protected. So if you quoe for top and mid and they find two people who are qued for those roles but they are autofilled protected, youd be switch to whatever is missing in that team

Okay but

If I have one of my rolls as support and none of my rolls as top
And a teammate has one of his rolls as top and none as support
There's absolutely no reason for me to be auto-filled to top while that teammate is auto-filled to support
So maybe that the second it was looking for top he came first and was just autofilled, then it went down the list. Never said it was perfect and will work like that 100% of the time

Okay but if you don't talk about the times that it isn't perfect it can never be fixed.

I like auto-fill. 
I don't like long queues.
I don't like when people on the same team are auto-filled into eachothers preferred rolls--because there's absolutely no reason for it to do this.

Ok but the thing is we KNOW it's not perfect. That's not what I'm talking about. Im talking about people trying to make it seem like they get autofilled every game, its over exaggeratting. Yea you may get auto-filled 1-2 times in a good amount of games that you get your main role. Get over it. Some people aren't picking certains roles. So if you take a second to think about it and use some type of logic to try and see why it could happen. You search for a match and it looks for 10 players. It picks 10 random players, now from those 10, maybe the first ones to accept got their role because they were the first ones and no one was there to contest. then it could just go by who joined in and what they wanted. Because im usually one of the first 2-3 to accept. I RARELY get autofilled. Played a total of 14 games the last 2 days and not one autofill. The times I do notice I get autofilled is when im almost last to accept and thats when im watching a video or ran to get a drink or something. We can talk about the imperfections all we want, doesn't mean it'll be fixed. Maybe itt's random. There is no certain code or order for it. You dont like when people on the same team are auto-filled into each others preferred roles? Like really? Is that something that really bugs you?
"damn I got mid but wanted top"
"damn I got top but wanted mid" 
Damn two people didn't get their role, whatever will they do? God forbid they just "lets switch?" no, no, thats using logic and we cant have that.

Oh, sure -- I don't have an issue with auto-fill existing. I like the idea of the queue style where you can select preferred roles and the system tries to find a game for you where you get to play your preferred roles as often as possible. The system works well and generally accomplishes it's goals.

##But that doesn't mean it's flawless.

And it certainly doesn't mean that we should just overlook it's flaws. I'm almost positive that when Riot designed the system they didn't intend for it to sometimes swap people when it wasn't necessary to do so.

"Hey Riot, I queued as Top/Mid and got auto-filled into ADC, but the guy who got assigned Mid queued as Jungle/ADC"

Just because you can switch doesn't make it a feature of the system to randomly make things more difficult.

Ok so we already established it isn't perfect, and has flaws. So kinda pointless to bring that up. You also missed the part where I said that maybe there was no secret coding or program for auto-fill and that it's entirely random. Cause you know, random is a thing that exist.
If it is random, then it shouldn't be. The goal of the system should be to help the most players.

Then make the codes and program it your self? You people think it's easy to just come up and code these things with perfections. You said you know it's not perfect, yet you still complain it's not perfect. You're pretty stupid. Majority of the people are getting what they want, so it is working. Just because you get a role you dont want or didn't que for doesn't mean it's not working. I'm done with you, you're too closed minded.

You're absolutely ridiculous.

How would the people who designed the program know that it isn't working as intended if you don't tell them?

You don't have an argument other than "deal with the bugs because programming is hard"

What a joke.

What I said was "it's silly" and "not perfect"

So that's pretty far from "you guys are shit"

Nice try though.

geeeez youre stupid. There is a big difference in telling them "hey this isn't working properly" instead of "you guys are shit. you cant even have autofill work in peoples favor, this game is shit". They know it's not perfect. i never said they weren't working on it or ignoring the issue. i dont have an argument? yet im sure i stated how its not perfect and there are many problems that come into play with the system, which you just seemed to ignore. yes, you are a joke.
I had quite a few situations where I queued, for example, top/mid and got adc, or mid/adc and got top, or once even top/adc and got mid.
That's what auto-fill is.. Filling you in what the team is missing.

Are you telling me there was a deficit of mid laner?

Despite the fact it says there are so many people playing that role they have higher queue times than everybody else?

So when you search for a match what happens? It looks for 10 players right? Well what if in those 10 players no one picked mid? So yea, there could be adeficit of a mid laner in the 5 people that were randomly added into your team. Mid maybe a highly contested role, but doesn't mean EVERYONE wants mid or always picks mid. I get autofilled mid more than I do support. So are you telling me there are more support players than mid players?

I've been out of statistics for a few years, but for your anomaly to be more than unlikely occurrence you would need like 2k games to validate it. This isn't even taking in the differences in player pools at different elos or anything. I have seen someone get autofilled twice to mid when I always have it as my primary so yeah the game will throw people into other teammates prefer'd roles.

I explained this in my previous reply that you ignored :P

"It has 0 checks in place to make sure the lowest number of players get filled."
Ok, so for your anomaly to be true, you would have had to play 2k games in each elo, taking account of player pools, and what region youre playing on. I saw what you wrote.
An anomaly is something against the norm,  plenty of people have agreed with me yet everyone seems to not agree with you. So you saw what I wrote, now lets work on understanding it.

So youre just gonna ignore what i said? You say what i said wasnt valid because i dont have enough games played, yet you say they have 0 checks to make sure the lowest people get filled. and i say the exact same thing you say. clearly youre not understanding.

Son if you still don't understand after 18 days of thinking on it, just let it go. I'm not going to explain again why you saying nobody picking mid is an anomaly, while me saying nobody plays support and the system just sucks is not one because everyone else here is saying they had similar experiences. Here are a few quotes you seem to have missed of people saying they had similar experiences/evidence for this being the norm.

> If I have one of my rolls as support and none of my rolls as top
> And a teammate has one of his rolls as top and none as support
> There's absolutely no reason for me to be auto-filled to top while that teammate is auto-filled to support

> Are you telling me there was a deficit of mid laner?
> Despite the fact it says there are so many people playing that role they have higher queue times than everybody else?

> I like auto-fill.
> I don't like long queues.
> I don't like when people on the same team are auto-filled into each others preferred rolls--because there's absolutely no reason for it to do this.

The point of this worthless matchmaking system is to cater to the role selection.

If it doesn't, then there's a fundamental problem with it which should be fixed.

But if people aren't picking certain roles then what? Since you so clearly know the answer, fix it. Clearly you don't understand everything can't be perfect, or at least we hope so. It's random. You act like you can't fix the problem. If you didn't get the role you wanted, ask the team if anyone is willing to switch. If no one is, then that clearly means that you just got autofilled into a position that was needed to quickly fill your team. If someone is willing to trade, then well, trade and get the game moving with. It's as simple as that. Is it perfect? No. Can it be better? Yes. But you people just assume its so EASY to fix problems. Coding is very complicated,  the algorythems, everything, you guys dont take a second to think. If it was so easy, it would have been fixed. No one wants mistakes or problems in their game for people to complain about.

I've played only my placements on my main and I had 2 or more players filled in 4 games. Usually I would get top/support while queuing as mid/jungle, in 2 of those games I traded with people who queued for the role I got filled for. I do acknowledge however that this is much less common even on my plat smurf (and almost never happens on my other accounts).
So we know it's not perfect. But if so many people are getting filled into a role they don't want, then it's so easy to trade with someone for the role you do want.

this one game I got autofilled mid.
I had a mid primary in my group. he got my role.
I was very confused.
Why the fuck do I keep queuing as support primary and getting an autofilled support on my team?
Codemancy is strong magic

This has happened to me as well lol.
Went sup/bot and got mid

> [{quoted}](name=T0rvald,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=BnpYIoEj,comment-id=,timestamp=2016-12-24T01:45:01.246+0000)
>
> http://i0.kym-cdn.com/photos/images/newsfeed/001/051/057/4cf.jpg
> 
> What occult magic has taken place for this divine privilege to be gifted upon me?
> 
> 
> 
> 
> Has this happened to anyone else? How frequently?

ppl are pussing out of midlane because of new champs and things like yasuo getting strong I imagine lol
I'd imagine it's mostly because the new jungle leaves the jungler enough time to clear their jungle and still spend half of the game camping mid.

I thought it was an obvious play on the irony of autofill actually filling any role, despite the abundant complaints of just getting filled into support. 'Sure you aren't the one being ignorant?

If you really want to get all uppity about a half-hearted post, _be my guest_. Far be it from me to stop you from stirring in your computer chair making a sour fit because I cracked a joke.

I choose AD Primary, Support secondary. Always Support. Which is fine, I now MAIN Support. I wish sometimes to AD. So I started to learn Mid, but it's not good enough for ranked atm. So now I'll never AD in ranked. :\ {{sticker:zombie-nunu-tears}}

Probably for the best. The meta favours immobile ADC/MID at the moment and ADC's tend to get shit on instantly. Also roams bot are happening all the time now that the FOTM junglers are also the best gankers/initiators.

Que Mid/Top, get ADC. 

Can I support?

I have always been autofilled protected due to me constantly playing Support.

Luckily, I'm a Support main, so it doesn't bother me that I am support.
https://memecrunch.com/meme/7NQ2T/lucky-son-of-a-bitch-meme/image.png?w=400&c=1

Qued top with support as secondary. Got top 18 matches in a row. 18 match win streak, i que up with a Vayne i got along with, i set support as primary and top secondary. I get support, we stomp the lane so hard our team just groups bot and breaks their nexus at 18 min. I get autofill protection and end up getting top the two next matches despite having support as primary.

I qued top get autofilled pick bard win game
next game autofill again wtf????

I up voted because that funny pic of Hank hill.

Gawahhhh
I got filled support and switched to mid with someone, we both got autofill protected
Been autofilled mid and adc more than support lately
one time this happened to me.

I think if u have the auto fill/support protected you should have the option to only choose 1 role if u want... i always queue support/mid in that order.. i have found tryin to carry randoms to stressful.. so ill babysit and carry from a far... but when i DO want mid.. i should be allowed to only queue for that role to guarantee me that role..  none of this "you will be guaranteed one of your desired roles" crap cause at that point im queued up for Mid/support...
